intro: Orobus vukotinovicii, commonly known as the Vukotinović's orobus, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, preferring well-drained soils. It features small, pea-like flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
